text: [Music]
hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum for you
hollandaise sauce it's one of my
favorite things but often times is
intimidating to make at home and people
think or when they try their hollandaise
sauce turns out like this broken chunky
and kind of thin in some places what
you're really looking for is something
that's thick rich and delicious like
this version that i have here well today
i'm going to show you how to make the
perfect hollandaise sauce and it only
takes five ingredients and it's really
fast to make because we're using a
blender for this no double boiler no
tricky equipment really really simple
i'm going to start with one and a half
sticks of unsalted butter which I have
melted over a very low heat you don't
want it to be too Heikes you want to
boil the butter so this looks really
good here and now I need my second
ingredient the egg yolks and egg yolks
help with creating a wonderful
emulsification and that gives you that
rich thick texture that we all know
hollandaise sauce to have so I'm going
to crack my eggs and when you crack eggs
crack them on a flat surface don't crack
them on the side of the bowl because
what happens if you crack it on the side
of the bowl the shell comes up into the
egg and that's how you get more shell in
your eggs three egg yolks for this
recipe and now I'm going to decant the
butter that I've melted into a glass
measuring cup so now the three egg yolks
go right into the jar of the blender
here and to that a pinch of cayenne
pepper
so that's ingredient number three a half
a teaspoon of kosher salt number four
and one teaspoon of freshly squeezed
lemon juice this is going to blend up
I'm going to take off the top here so I
can easily pour the butter in use a
little towel here to cover it up and
start blending this
so this is nicely incorporated here and
now I'm going to add the butter in a
slow steady stream you don't want to add
it too fast otherwise you risk breaking
the hollandaise so a thin slow stream
[Applause]
so all of the butter has gone in the
hollandaise is really nice and thick and
this is also a good time to check the
seasoning to make sure that you have
enough salt if you wanted to add a
little bit more cayenne pepper you can
certainly do that at this point but you
can see how rich and creamy it is and it
only really took about two minutes in
the blender so this is a really fast
process I'm going to give just a little
bit of lemon juice to thin it out
slightly and a pinch of salt give this a
quick mix and now I'm ready to serve
today I'm going to use my hollandaise
sauce on some eggs benedict so I have
some perfectly poached eggs Canadian
bacon and English muffins the classic
Eggs Benedict and to top it all off some
delicious rich hollandaise sauce now you
could certainly use hollandaise sauce
with many other things some steamed
asparagus it's really great along sides
and fish and if you were making
hollandaise sauce for a big party or a
brunch or something like that you can
make it in advance but you really only
want to hold it for about 30 minutes and
you can do that in a water bath or what
I like to do I like to store it in a
thermos because it really keeps the heat
but this method of making hollandaise
sauce is so easy and fast I'm sure
you'll be making it every single weekend
for your brunch enjoy
[Music]
